intro: Vappodes bigibba, commonly known as the giant sarsaparilla, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
